result.execSummary:
The defendant Martell Antonio Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; random screening.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, if not already done. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 8-15-14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant - bail to apply.
Be enrolled in a school program or be employed.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - for the 1st violation in which the Court is notifed with ten days of the violation defendant is ordered to serve 5 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time; for the 2nd violation defendant to served 10 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time; for the 3rd violation defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time; for the 4th violation defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martell Antonio Green

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $50 per month commencing 8-15-14 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant - bail to apply; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed; 6) be enrolled in a school program or be employed; 7) SERVE 105  DAYS at the House of Correction - STAYED - for the 1st violation in which the Court is notifed with ten days of the violation defendant is ordered to serve 5 days at the House of Correction 
- straight time - no good time; for the 2nd violation defendant to served 10 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time; for the 3rd violation defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time; for the 4th violation defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Martell Antonio Green in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve  12 months at the House of Correction - straight time - with 6 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

Defendant Martell Antonio Green in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Because of the possibility of incarceration, the defendant should be prepared to begin serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

-Scanned; ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Martell Antonio Green in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Nathaniel Adamson for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Exhibit is ordered withdrawn.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Martell Antonio Green in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Martell Antonio Green in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
